TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IncrementalStrokeHitTester extends System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalHitTester

Docs.summary: Dynamically hit tests a stroke with an eraser path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IncrementalStrokeHitTester hit tests strokes by determining when a eraser path intersects that stroke. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalHitTester.AddPoints%2A> method in the stylus events to add the points to the IncrementalStrokeHitTester. When the points added to the IncrementalStrokeHitTester intersect a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the IncrementalStrokeHitTester raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester.StrokeHit> event.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to dynamically erase a portion of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. To create a control that enables a user to erase ink, see [How to: Erase Ink on a Custom Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
[!code-cs[InkEraser#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/MyInkEraser/InkEraser.cs#2)] [!code-vb[InkEraser#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/MyInkEraser/InkEraser.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddPointsCore(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Point> points) cil managed
.method familyhidebysig instance void OnStrokeHit(class System.Windows.Ink.StrokeHitEventArgs eventArgs) cil managed

Docs.summary: Occurs when the intersects an ink .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to dynamically erase a portion of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. To create a control that enables a user to erase ink, see [How to: Erase Ink on a Custom Control](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
